resource_dependency.map_api: An interactive map API such as Leaflet.js or Google Maps API for rendering neighborhood boundaries and data points.
resource_dependency.charting_library: A charting library like Chart.js or D3.js for creating interactive visualizations of demographic, economic, and crime data.
resource_dependency.dashboard_layout_schema: Database schema for storing user dashboard preferences including component positions and visibility settings.
resource_dependency.user_auth_schema: Database schema for user accounts including user_id (unique ID), username (string), email (string), password_hash (string), created_at (timestamp).

function: Displays an interactive map interface that allows users to visualize neighborhood data on a geographical layer.
static_description: The main view contains a full-screen map interface with a toolbar at the top containing search, filter, and export icons. The map displays neighborhood boundaries overlaid with data markers. The background color is set to ivory (#FFFFF0), and all UI controls use forest green (#228B22) accents.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking on a neighborhood boundary selects it for comparison. Clicking again deselects it.
Hovering over a neighborhood shows a tooltip with basic information such as name and selected metric value.
Scrolling zooms in or out on the map.

resource_dependency.selected_neighborhoods_storage: Frontend state management to track currently selected neighborhoods for comparison.
resource_dependency.comparison_data_schema: Database schema for storing neighborhood comparison metadata including area_id (foreign key), selected_metrics (array of strings), and timestamps.

function: Allows users to select and compare multiple neighborhoods by clicking on them in the map interface.
static_description: Below the map is a horizontal bar showing selected neighborhoods. Each item includes the neighborhood name and a remove button. The bar scrolls horizontally when more than three items are selected.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking on a neighborhood on the map adds it to the selection bar. Clicking again removes it.
Clicking the remove button next to a neighborhood in the selection bar removes it from the comparison.

resource_dependency.demographic_data_api: API endpoint for fetching demographic data including population count, age distribution (array of age groups), and average household income (number).
resource_dependency.demo_chart_component: Chart component configured to display demographic data using a bar or pie chart.

function: Shows demographic data for selected neighborhoods including population, age distribution, and household income.
static_description: A section beneath the map displays demographic cards with population statistics and a chart visualization. Cards are arranged in a grid layout with each card representing one selected neighborhood. Chart uses forest green for bars and ivory background.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking on a demographic card opens a detailed modal showing breakdowns by age group and income levels.
Hovering over chart elements highlights corresponding data points.

resource_dependency.economic_data_api: API endpoint for fetching economic data including employment rate (percentage), median household income (number), and industry breakdown (array of sectors).
resource_dependency.economic_chart_component: Chart component configured to display economic data using line or bar charts.

function: Shows economic data for selected neighborhoods including employment rates and median household income.
static_description: A dedicated section below demographic data presents economic metrics in a tabular and graphical format. Includes a summary table and a chart component showing trends over time. Uses forest green accents for visual indicators.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking on an economic metric card expands to show a detailed breakdown of industries and income sources.
Hovering over chart lines or bars displays tooltips with precise values.

resource_dependency.crime_data_api: API endpoint for fetching crime data including incident types (array of strings), frequency counts per category, and geographic clustering.
resource_dependency.crime_chart_component: Chart component configured to show crime incidents using heat maps or stacked bar graphs.

function: Shows crime data for selected neighborhoods including incident types and frequency.
static_description: A separate panel displays crime statistics in a heatmap and bar chart format. Each neighborhoodâ€™s crime data is represented visually with color-coded categories and numerical summaries. Background remains ivory with forest green highlights.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking on a crime category filters the map and charts to only show that type of incident.
Hovering over a crime cluster shows a popup with details about incidents in that zone.

resource_dependency.interactive_charts_library: Library for creating dynamic charts (e.g., Chart.js or Plotly) that update based on selected neighborhoods and filters.
resource_dependency.chart_config_schema: Database schema to store chart configurations including type (line/bar/pie), axes labels, colors, and grouping options.

function: Provides interactive charts for visualizing demographic, economic, and crime data.
static_description: Multiple chart containers are displayed side-by-side within the dashboard layout. Each chart corresponds to a specific dataset type (demographics, economy, crime). Charts feature axis labels, legends, and tooltips. Background is ivory, with forest green chart elements.

interaction_and_states.description: Users can drag and rearrange chart components within the dashboard to customize layout.
Clicking legend items toggles visibility of chart series.

resource_dependency.dashboard_layout_api: Backend API endpoint for saving and retrieving user-customized dashboard layouts.
resource_dependency.draggable_component_lib: UI library enabling drag-and-drop functionality for dashboard components.

function: Enables customization of dashboard layouts with draggable components.
static_description: Dashboard layout consists of resizable panels containing various widgets such as maps, tables, and charts. Panels can be moved, resized, and reorganized via drag-and-drop. All panels maintain a consistent color scheme with ivory backgrounds and forest green borders.

interaction_and_states.description: Dragging a widget to a new position updates the layout in real-time and persists changes to the backend.
Clicking the maximize/minimize icon toggles panel size between expanded and compact views.

resource_dependency.backend_api_endpoint: RESTful API endpoints for retrieving neighborhood data from the PostgreSQL database.
resource_dependency.data_fetching_middleware: Middleware logic for handling real-time data fetching and caching strategies.

function: Supports real-time data fetching from backend APIs to keep information current.
static_description: Data refresh buttons appear periodically in the UI to manually trigger updates. Loading spinners indicate ongoing data requests. All data is fetched dynamically without hard-coded content.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the refresh button initiates a new data fetch from the backend API.
Hovering over a loading spinner shows a tooltip indicating data status.

resource_dependency.ui_theme_config: CSS theme configuration setting background to ivory (#FFFFF0) and foreground elements to forest green (#228B22).
resource_dependency.responsive_design_rules: Media queries ensuring proper scaling for mobile and desktop screens.

function: Implements a clean UI with ivory background and forest green accents throughout the application.
static_description: All major containers and headers utilize an ivory background while buttons, links, and interactive elements are styled with forest green. Typography and spacing follow a consistent design language. Layout adapts smoothly across device sizes.

resource_dependency.time_range_filter: Dropdown menu allowing users to select time ranges for filtering data (e.g., last month, last year).
resource_dependency.metric_filters: Checkboxes or toggle switches to enable/disable specific metrics for display.

function: Allows users to filter data by time range or specific metrics.
static_description: At the top of the dashboard, a filter bar contains dropdowns for selecting date ranges and checkboxes for enabling/disabling certain data categories. Filtered data updates immediately upon selection.

interaction_and_states.description: Selecting a time range from the dropdown applies the filter to all charts and tables.
Toggling a metric checkbox hides or shows related data in charts and tables.

resource_dependency.export_functionality_api: Backend API endpoint for generating downloadable reports in formats like PDF or CSV.

function: Enables export functionality for dashboard data and charts.
static_description: An export button is located in the top-right corner of the dashboard. When clicked, it generates a report including current data and visualizations in downloadable formats.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the export button opens a dialog box to choose export format (PDF, CSV).
After choosing a format, the system triggers a download of the generated file.

resource_dependency.auth_backend_api: Authentication service providing login/logout endpoints with JWT tokens for session management.
resource_dependency.session_storage: Frontend mechanism to store user sessions securely after login.

function: Provides user authentication and session management for personalized experiences.
static_description: A login screen appears at startup requiring credentials. Once logged in, a profile icon appears in the header. Logged-in users can save custom dashboards and preferences.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the login button submits credentials to authenticate the user.
Clicking the logout link ends the session and redirects to the login screen.

resource_dependency.neighborhood_search_api: API endpoint for searching neighborhoods by name or coordinates.
resource_dependency.search_bar_input: Text input field for entering neighborhood names or addresses.

function: Includes search functionality to find specific neighborhoods.
static_description: A prominent search bar at the top of the page allows users to enter neighborhood names or locations. Search results are displayed in a dropdown below the input field.

interaction_and_states.description: As the user types, live suggestions appear based on matching neighborhood names.
Clicking a suggestion centers the map on that neighborhood and selects it for comparison.

resource_dependency.mobile_breakpoints: Responsive CSS media queries targeting screen widths below 768px for mobile optimization.
resource_dependency.touch_support_lib: Touch event handlers for mobile-friendly interactions like pinch-to-zoom and swipe gestures.

function: Ensures responsive design for desktop and mobile devices.
static_description: The layout adjusts automatically depending on screen width. On smaller screens, components stack vertically, and touch targets increase in size. Map and chart areas scale appropriately for small screens.

interaction_and_states.description: On mobile devices, swiping left/right navigates between tabs or datasets.
Pinching the map zooms in or out on mobile touchscreens.

resource_dependency.postgres_connection_env_vars: Environment variables DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp used to connect to the PostgreSQL database.
resource_dependency.database_tables_schema: Schema definition for tables including neighborhoods (id, name, bounds), demographics (neighborhood_id, population, age_groups), economics (neighborhood_id, employment_rate, median_income), crimes (neighborhood_id, incident_type, count).

function: Integrates PostgreSQL database with environment variables for secure connection.
static_description: The backend connects to the PostgreSQL instance using predefined environment variables. Database tables store structured neighborhood data including demographic, economic, and crime metrics.
